snippet: Jack Bauer was part of a two-man breakaway for almost all of Stage 15 at the Tour de France, but he finished in 10th after a group that included Alexander Kristoff surged in front.
abstract: Norwegian cyclist Alexander Kristoff wins Stage 15 of Tour de France bicycle race; New Zealander Jack Bauer, who was part of two-man breakaway with Switzerland's Martin Elmiger for almost the entirety of the 138-mile stage, finishes 10th; Italian Vincenzo Nibali retains overall lead.
lead_paragraph: Jack Bauer was part of a two-man breakaway for almost all of Stage 15 at the Tour de France, but he finished in 10th after a group that included Alexander Kristoff surged in front.

headline.seo: Tour de France 2014: Kristoff Passes Bauer on Final Stretch to Win Stage 15
headline.main: A Thrilling Sprint Dashes a Dream and Snatches a Victory
headline.print_headline: A Thrilling Sprint Dashes a Dream and Snatches a Victory
